pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This is a theorem from #6091

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: We have [Real.IsConjugateExponent](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Real/ConjugateExponents.html#Real.IsConjugateExponent). IMHO, should be used here.

> We have [Real.IsConjugateExponent](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Real/ConjugateExponents.html#Real.IsConjugateExponent). IMHO, should be used here.

Done. I also added `rayleigh'` that uses `IsConjugateExponent` as a hypothesis.

Would it be nicer to first prove the generalization here (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beatty_sequence#Generalizations) involving floor and ceiling - 1? That way you don't have to bother with positivity and irrationality until the end.

Why not use `Real.IsConjugateExponent` all the way through? It seems to make things easier. For example:
```
variable {r s : ℝ}

theorem no_collision (h : r.IsConjugateExponent s) : Disjoint (beattySet r) (beattySet' s) := by
  rw [Set.disjoint_left]
  intro j ⟨k, h₁⟩ ⟨m, h₂⟩
  rw [beattySequence, Int.floor_eq_iff,
      ← mul_le_mul_right h.symm.pos, ← mul_lt_mul_right h.symm.pos, mul_assoc] at h₁
  rw [beattySequence', sub_eq_iff_eq_add, Int.ceil_eq_iff,
      Int.cast_add, Int.cast_one, add_sub_cancel,
      ← mul_lt_mul_right h.pos, ← mul_le_mul_right h.pos, mul_assoc, mul_comm s r] at h₂
  have h₃ := add_lt_add_of_lt_of_le h₂.1 h₁.1
  have h₄ := add_lt_add_of_le_of_lt h₂.2 h₁.2
  rw [← mul_add, ← add_mul, h.mul_eq_add, mul_lt_mul_right (add_pos h.pos h.symm.pos)] at h₃ h₄
  rw [← Int.cast_add, Int.cast_lt, ← not_le] at h₃
  rw [← Int.cast_one, ← Int.cast_add, ← Int.cast_add, Int.cast_lt, Int.lt_add_one_iff] at h₄
  exact h₃ h₄
```

> Why not use `Real.IsConjugateExponent` all the way through? It seems to make things easier.

I made this change and the proof became shorter. I also slightly golfed your proof of `no_collision`.

I don't think `rayleigh_xxx'` is necessary anymore, so I removed these extra theorems.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6442741740/job/17493883529)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6442741740/job/17493883748)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I think there's still a few golfing opportunities, but I'm mostly happy with it now!

maintainer merge
Can you ensure that every statement is available both under `name` for the "all of `Int`" version and `name_pos` for the `> 0` version?

I think there's still a few golfing opportunities, but I'm mostly happy with it now!

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I wonder if it might be better to define this as an actual infinite sequence indexed by integers (i.e. a function from integers to integers) rather than a set. That seems useful for other applications of this sequence at least
Done. I split the definition into `beattySequence` and `beattySet`.
Can you instead phrase this in terms of https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Init/Set.html#Set.compl
Done. The statement is now `(beattySet r)ᶜ = beattySet' r.conjugateExponent`.
Can you instead phrase this in terms of https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Disjoint.html#Disjoint
Done. The statement is now `Disjoint (beattySet r) (beattySet' r.conjugateExponent)`.
This should be moved to `Mathlib.Data.Real.ConjugateExponents`
Done. I removed `s_gt_1`, and added `Real.one_lt_conjugateExponent` to this file.
Can you instead phrase this in terms of https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Init/Set.html#Set.compl
Done. The statement is now `(beattySet r)ᶜ = beattySet' s`.
This is a lot of definitions for little use. Could you try inlining them (at least the `Set` versions)? I doubt this will readability too much.
Done.

```suggestion
    ∀ {j : ℤ}, 0 < j→ j ∈ beattySetPos r ∆ beattySetPos' s := by
```
or maybe even
```suggestion
   beattySetPos r ∆ beattySetPos' s = {n | 0 < n} := by
```
Done. I used the second statement because it's stronger.
Is there not a version of this theorem for `beattySet`/`beattySet'`?

Yes, `rayleigh_compl` is a version for all integers. I included `rayleigh_pos` because it wasn't that easy to restrict `rayleigh_compl` to the positive integers.

Edit: `rayleigh_compl` was renamed to `compl_beattySeq`

```suggestion
theorem compl_beattySequence {r s : ℝ} (hrs : r.IsConjugateExponent s) :
    {beattySequence r k | k}ᶜ = {beattySequence' s k | k} := by
```
and you should also have `compl_beattySequence'`.
Done. Also, I added a `'` version for both `compl_beattySequence` and `rayleigh_pos`.

```suggestion
  · rintro _ ⟨k, ⟨hk, -⟩, rfl⟩ | ⟨k, ⟨hk, -⟩, rfl⟩ <;>
```
Good golfing technique. I added this to `rayleigh_pos`.

This proof sounds too complicated given that you should just say `Irrational r → beattySequence' r = beattySequence r` (which could be a simp lemma, btw) and `r.IsConjugateExponent s → (Irrational r ↔ Irrational s)`.

I added `irr_beattySequence_pos_eq` as a helper theorem.
Proof of `rayleigh_irr_pos` has been shorted to 1 line.

I would state it the other way, from the assumption that `beattySequence` is simpler than `beattySequence'`
```suggestion
    {beattySequence' r k | k > 0} = {beattySequence r k | k > 0} := by
```
Done. `beattySequence` is simpler.

```suggestion
theorem Irrational.beattySequence_pos_eq {r : ℝ} (hr : Irrational r) :
```

```suggestion
  exact (hr.int_mul hk.ne').ne_int ⌊k * r⌋ h.symm
```

This is still a pretty poor name. What about 
```suggestion
theorem Irrational.beattySequence'_symmDiff_beattySequence_pos {r s : ℝ}
    (hrs : r.IsConjugateExponent s) (hr : Irrational r) :
    {beattySequence r k | k > 0} ∆ {beattySequence s k | k > 0} = {n | 0 < n} := by
```
Done. I renamed `rayleigh_pos`, `rayleigh_pos'`, and `rayleigh_irr_pos`.
Outdated lemma name

Fixed.
Also, I think `beattySequence` is too long, so I shortened it to `beattySeq` in every name.
I would advise to make this lemma and the next two private.
Done. The helper theorems are all private now.
You should prove `beattySequence' r = beattySequence r` instead.
I'm not sure how to express this. I'm having trouble with k=0 because `beattySeq' r 0 = -1` and `beattySeq r 0 = 0`.
Ah of course. Then it's probably fine like that.

```suggestion
    j ∈ {beattySeq r k | k} ∨ ∃ k : ℤ, k * r < j ∧ j + 1 ≤ (k + 1) * r := by
```
Done. I removed all redundant parentheses.

```suggestion
  exact h₄.not_le h₃
```
Done. (the correct term was `h₄.not_lt h₃`)

```suggestion
  simp only [←div_le_iff, ←le_div_iff, ←div_lt_iff, ←lt_div_iff, hrs.pos, hrs.symm.pos] at h₁₁ h₁₂ h₂₁ h₂₂
```

Done.
(I managed to golf this away in "More golf v2")
Done.

```suggestion
    exact_mod_cast pos_of_mul_pos_left (zero_lt_one.trans_le hj) hs
```
Done. Today I learned about `exact_mod_cast`.

```suggestion
    exact_mod_cast pos_of_mul_pos_left hj hs
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory): Rayleigh's theorem
